result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas O. Grimm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at $25 per month commencing 09-01-2015 and the 1st of each month thereafter or serve 8 days jail with huber as penalty for failure to pay.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas O. Grimm in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, supervised by Tim Westphal, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following: 
- Fine totaling: $379.00 to be paid at rate of $25.00 per month commencing September 1, 2015; alternate 8 days Huber
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   
Defendant Thomas O. Grimm did not appear.   
Case scheduled for 2:30 p.m. and Matter called @ 3:30 p.m.

Court orders a Stayed Warrant to the next court date.
MANDATORY APPEARANCE IS REQUIRED.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
